intro: Galium subvelutinum subsp. leiophyllum, commonly known as the silky bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium subvelutinum subsp. leiophyllum typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
